data.title: UEFA EURO 2024 – Olympiastadion Berlin
data.text:
“United by Football. Vereint im Herzen Europas” – Berlin is looking forward to the UEFA EURO 2024. The Olympiastadion Berlin will host six games in the summer of 2024. The entire world of football will set their eyes on Berlin on July 14th, 2024, when the two best european teams in will face off in the final in the Olympiastadion.

In June and July 2024, the Olympiastadion Berlin will once again be transformed into a temple of football: As the largest of all 10 stadiums in the UEFA EURO 2024, six games will take place in the Olympiastadion Berlin. Highlight: The final on July 14th, 2024.

All six games at a glance:

Saturday, June 15th, 2024 – Group B: Spain – Croatia

Friday, June 21st, 2024 – Group D: Poland – Austria

Tuesday, June 25th, 2024 – Group D: Netherlands – Austria

Saturday, June 29th, 2024 – Round of 16

Saturday, July 6th, 2024 – Quarter-finals

Sunday, July 14th, 2024 – Final

Besides the matches, there will be a creative, unifying and, above all, sustainable festival for all visitors, fans and Berliners – of course – in the heart of the city. The public will watch soccer together and enjoy the cultural program.

The numerous projects, as part of the Host City Berlin’s extensive sustainability program, will also offer a wide range of activities and events. A program Berlin can be proud of!

More about the Host City Berlin

The countdown to UEFA EURO 2024 is on and it’s time to start planning!

In the UEFA Event Guide you will find all the important information you need to plan your EURO 2024 experience in Berlin, regardless of whether you have tickets for a game or want to take part in the numerous celebrations in the city.

Further details will be gradually published there until the tournament starts, so keep checking the Event Guide to not miss out on any updates.

To the event guide
